required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing the Tobacco Cessation Clinical Decision Support Tool.
clinical_study.official_title: Using Rapid Cycle Randomized Controlled Trials to Study a Tobacco Cessation Best Practice Advisory.

brief_summary.textblock: The existing tobacco cessation best practice advisory (BPA) fires for providers (physicians, residents, fellows, midwives, nurse practitioners, physician assistants) during outpatient encounters when a patient is identified as a current tobacco user in the Social History section of their chart. The BPA was designed to help facilitate tobacco cessation interventions; it is part of the The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Quality Payment Program (QPP). The purpose of the project is to optimize this BPA utilization and improve patient outcomes by comparing multiple versions of the tobacco cessation BPA.

intervention.description: The intervention includes different versions of the BPA design and message.
The intervention includes different versions of the BPA design and message.
The intervention includes different versions of the BPA design and message.

study_pop.textblock: All providers of patients at NYU Langone Health (including NYU Winthrop) who are identified as currents smokers, as documented in the social history of their patient chart, and are eligible to receive the best practice advisory for tobacco cessation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All providers of patients at NYU Langone Health (including NYU Winthrop) who are identified as currents smokers, as documented in the social history of their patient chart, and are eligible to receive the best practice advisory for tobacco cessation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- non smokers

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
